page.title: 03TANGIER FARM-LAND USE
page.content: {Tangier Farm, Bishops Waltham (G.R. SU {539172) The farm buildings are actually located outside the study area, but much of the land is within it so is included here. Tangier Farm comprises 133 acres of wet, heavy clay with occasional patches of sand and gravel. It lies in a sheltered area about 180 feet above sea level, with winds from the S.E. bringing rain and winds from the N.W. bringing drying conditions. Of the 133 acres, 117 are used for pastoral beef, the other 16 for maize growing. The present beef stock is made up of three main breeds: Hereford Cross, Fresian and Aberdeen Angus. The herd totals 200 head
